This article's use of external links may not follow Wikipedia's policies or guidelines. Please improve this article by removing excessive or inappropriate external links, and converting useful links where appropriate into footnote references. (October 2016) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

This is a list of recurring linguistics conferences. Included are also a list of organisations that hold recurring meetings under the same name.

Contents

  • 1 By geographical location
    • 1.1 International
    • 1.2 North America
    • 1.3 South America
    • 1.4 Europe
    • 1.5 Asia
    • 1.6 Africa
    • 1.7 Australia
  • 2 By subfield
    • 2.1 Phonetics
    • 2.2 Phonology
    • 2.3 Morphology
    • 2.4 Syntax
    • 2.5 Semantics
    • 2.6 Core theory (all of the above)
    • 2.7 Psycholinguistics
    • 2.8 Cognitive linguistics
    • 2.9 Documentary linguistics
    • 2.10 Sociolinguistics and variation
    • 2.11 Acquisition
    • 2.12 Computational linguistics
    • 2.13 Pragmatics
    • 2.14 Onomastics
    • 2.15 Miscellaneous
  • 3 By language family
    • 3.1 Indo-European
      • 3.1.1 Germanic
      • 3.1.2 Romance
      • 3.1.3 Slavic
      • 3.1.4 Indo-Iranian
    • 3.2 Uralic/Finno-Ugric
    • 3.3 Languages of Asia
      • 3.3.1 Sino-Tibetan
      • 3.3.2 Austronesian
      • 3.3.3 Austroasiatic
      • 3.3.4 Papuan
      • 3.3.5 Altaic
      • 3.3.6 Dravidian
    • 3.4 Languages of Africa
      • 3.4.1 Afro-Asiatic
    • 3.5 Languages of the Americas
    • 3.6 Caribbean languages, including creoles
    • 3.7 Auxiliary languages
    • 3.8 Areal/non-genetic

By geographical location[edit]

International[edit]

  • Association for Laboratory Phonology (LabPhon)
  • Formal Approaches to Slavic Linguistics (FASL)
  • International Conference on Sociolinguistics
  • Southeast Asian Linguistics Society (SEALS)
  • International Congress of Linguists (ICL)

North America[edit]

  • American Dialect Society (ADS)
  • Canadian Linguistic Association (CLA)
  • Chicago Linguistic Society (CLS)
  • Linguistic Society of America (LSA)
  • North American Conference on Chinese Linguistics (NACCL)
  • West Coast Conference on Formal Linguistics (WCCFL)
  • Western Conference on Linguistics
  • Workshop on Structure and Constituency in Languages of the Americas (WSCLA)

South America[edit]

  • Associação Brasileira de Linguística (ABRALIN)

Europe[edit]

  • Days of Swiss Linguistics (DSL)
  • Generative Linguistics in the Old World (GLOW)
  • International Conference on Sociolinguistics ("ICS")
  • Moscow Student Conference on Linguistics (MSCL)

Asia[edit]

Africa[edit]

  • West African Linguistic Society (WALS)

Australia[edit]

This section is empty. You can help by adding to it. (October 2016)

  • INTERSPEECH
  • International Congress of Phonetic Sciences (ICPhS)

Sociolinguistics and variation[edit]

  • International Gender and Language Association (IGALA)
  • International Conference on Sociolinguistics ("ICS")
  • New Ways of Analyzing Variation (NWAV)

Acquisition[edit]

  • Generative Approaches to Language Acquisition (GALA)
  • Generative Approaches to Second Language Acquisition Conference (GASLA)
  • Generative Approaches to Language Acquisition - North America (GALANA)
  • Boston University Conference on Language Development (BUCLD)
  • Annual Conference of the European Second Language Association (EuroSLA)
  • Annual Conference of the Japan Second Language Association (J-SLA)
  • Congress of the International Association for the Study of Child Language (IASCL)

Computational linguistics[edit]

  • Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)
  • International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC)
  • International Conference on Intelligent Text Processing and Computational Linguistics (CICLing)
